messages.content: You are an AI assistant that helps people find information. You will receive a task and think step by step. Then provide your final outcome following the regular expression 'Answer: [A-Za-z ]+'

Imagine a flower county with six flower fields. From the entrance you have two choices, you can go to the rose field or sunflower field. You enter the rose field, at the other end of this field there's a door that leads to the tulip field, and the tulip field leads to the orchid field. From the orchid field, you can have 10 orchid flowers for free, but you do not take any flower, you're just learning about the environment. Then you exit and start over. This time in the entrance you choose the sunflower field, which has a door to the daisy field, and the daisy field has a door that leads to the hydrangea field. You can have 50 hydrangea flowers from the hydrangea field, but you do not take any flowers, you're just learning about the environment. You return to the entrance. You will only be able to choose one path that leads to the maximum number of flowers. Which field from the entrance will lead to the path with the maximum number of flowers?

Step 1: Let the entrances be represented by 2 choices : Rose(R) & Sunflower (S)
Step 2: Rose → (orchid field R -> Tulip field T)
Sunflower ← → daisy field S -> hydrangea field H
Please let  A..T indicate any type of non limitless flower.
I will now solve in this order
1 rose then sunflower field
It’s clear from this solution. This solution gets you maximum result. To get up there your route path would  as follows R+R’ +R’-R. Since tulipp + Orchids 
The anmswer:

You reach the entrance and this time you encounter a new field, lily field. The lily field leads to the peony field, which in turn leads to the hydrangea field. When you return to the entrance and choose the path that leads to the maximum number of flowers, you discover that the regular path to the field with the maximum number of flowers is blocked. You go back to the entrance. You will only be able to choose one path that leads to the maximum number of flowers. Which field from the entrance will lead to the path with the maximum number of flowers?

Step 1: Consider the four choices: Rose(R), Sunflower(S), lily field (L), and peony field
Let N indicates maximum output(number in orchids) then our formula to determine the answer be R ->. L+ R’  with Orchniid (40.)
R represents rose field T which gives  T with no charge, which takes all petals for S,  H(50): and peonies all other flowers. To solve to answer N would have reached by taking only L in only flower R the choice, it's the following expression R +R', (291.) that' would guarantee optimality for orchids. Or S+S': that optimizing to guarantee hydrangea, (50). Our ans. in final: R; So Answer.: R; 
As the flower petal picker, should i pick just one? Choose only one or get both! Rose and sunflowar for two fields to gain maximum value of N:  answer : the Rose R.
user2 will ask the other for advice as usual but if asked any different. How does the assistant want to spend your free 35 flowers you received without charge? For example i am offered orchids(T, R'). They can put a few at 0, for instance. Will go: (Organie)15.  (Orch-ie) Or, say hydrangeas offered to choose any in all my (one or no zero in my bag R) which at an optimimun.  Which can maximize gain from S. The flowers you got before i choose is at '0 because as usual the free sample at maximum i chose were offered 35 free so hydrangeas at (255.), in an organized list from highest to htegisdt(27- zero(00) or ( H), I must spend it first on R, S on ( H  and put zero of dais, then 29 dais since they have 'e;  Then finally organizing as many to be daist: firstly (30 - zero ( Orch):  daisy (2e-one)- second hydrange
